description:
This modifies the way the DLE/DRE are set for Tipsy datasets.  In doing so I found a weird asymmetry in the unit registries as they were defined before -- this can be seen if a script is run with the changes to `static_output.py` included but not to `io.py`.  @bwkeller , what do you think?

UPDATE 1: Put `code_metallicity` back in -- thanks, @ngoldbaum !

UPDATE 2: Simplify logic for periodicity.  How's this look, @ngoldbaum ?
title: Fixing unitary for datasets without DLE/DRE.  Modify Tipsy domain.

pullrequest.title: Fixing unitary for datasets without DLE/DRE.  Modify Tipsy domain.

pullrequest.title: Fixing unitary for datasets without DLE/DRE.  Modify Tipsy domain.

content.raw: That's how Tipsy signifies that it needs to call `update_domain`.
content.html: That's how Tipsy signifies that it needs to call update_domain.

pullrequest.title: Fixing unitary for datasets without DLE/DRE.  Modify Tipsy domain.

content.raw: Ah I see.  I think you also need to ensure `domain_left_edge` and `domain_right_edge` are YTArray instances for periodic datasets.
content.html: Ah I see. I think you also need to ensure domain_left_edge and domain_right_edge are YTArray instances for periodic datasets.

pullrequest.title: Fixing unitary for datasets without DLE/DRE.  Modify Tipsy domain.

content.raw: Hm, I can't reproduce this here.  I don't know why the domain bounds are being set to -0.5.
content.html: Hm, I can't reproduce this here. I don't know why the domain bounds are being set to -0.5.

pullrequest.title: Fixing unitary for datasets without DLE/DRE.  Modify Tipsy domain.

content.raw: it's because the dataset is being read as periodic, so the domain edges are set in the `if self.parameters.get('bPeriodic', True)` block in the tipsy `_parse_parameter_file`.
content.html: it's because the dataset is being read as periodic, so the domain edges are set in the if self.parameters.get('bPeriodic', True) block in the tipsy _parse_parameter_file.

pullrequest.title: Fixing unitary for datasets without DLE/DRE.  Modify Tipsy domain.

content.raw: @bwkeller is it not the case that particle positions for periodic tipsy datasets are always between `[-0.5, -0.5, -0.5]` and `[0.5, 0.5, 0.5]`.  Right now the tipsy frontend assumes that to be the case but that assumption seems to be broken for the TipsyAuxiliary test dataset.
content.html: Ben Keller is it not the case that particle positions for periodic tipsy datasets are always between [-0.5, -0.5, -0.5] and [0.5, 0.5, 0.5]. Right now the tipsy frontend assumes that to be the case but that assumption seems to be broken for the TipsyAuxiliary test dataset.

pullrequest.title: Fixing unitary for datasets without DLE/DRE.  Modify Tipsy domain.

content.raw:
The following diff should restore `code_metallicity`:


```
#!diff

diff -r a90de64aa23f yt/data_objects/static_output.py
--- a/yt/data_objects/static_output.py  Wed Apr 16 20:18:51 2014 -0400
+++ b/yt/data_objects/static_output.py  Wed Apr 16 17:40:31 2014 -0700
@@ -574,6 +574,7 @@
         self.unit_registry.add("code_magnetic", 1.0, dimensions.magnetic_field)
         self.unit_registry.add("code_temperature", 1.0, dimensions.temperature)
         self.unit_registry.add("code_velocity", 1.0, dimensions.velocity)
+        self.unit_registry.add("code_metallicity", 1.0, dimensions.dimensionless)

     def set_units(self):
         """
```

If you want to leave it like this, you'll also need to update the Enzo frontend, where code_metallicity is also used.  Apologies for missing this when I removed the code units from the default unit lookup-table.
content.html:
The following diff should restore code_metallicity:

diff -r a90de64aa23f yt/data_objects/static_output.py
--- a/yt/data_objects/static_output.py  Wed Apr 16 20:18:51 2014 -0400
+++ b/yt/data_objects/static_output.py  Wed Apr 16 17:40:31 2014 -0700
@@ -574,6 +574,7 @@
         self.unit_registry.add("code_magnetic", 1.0, dimensions.magnetic_field)
         self.unit_registry.add("code_temperature", 1.0, dimensions.temperature)
         self.unit_registry.add("code_velocity", 1.0, dimensions.velocity)
+        self.unit_registry.add("code_metallicity", 1.0, dimensions.dimensionless)

     def set_units(self):
         """

If you want to leave it like this, you'll also need to update the Enzo frontend, where code_metallicity is also used. Apologies for missing this when I removed the code units from the default unit lookup-table.

pullrequest.title: Fixing unitary for datasets without DLE/DRE.  Modify Tipsy domain.

content.raw:
@ngoldbaum what is the value of `dPeriod` for your dataset that spans -2 to 2?  The logic in `data_structures.py` looks to me like:

```
            self.periodicity = (True, True, True)
            # If we are periodic, that sets our domain width to either 1 or dPeriod.
            self.domain_left_edge = np.zeros(3, "float64") - 0.5*self.parameters.get('dPeriod', 1)
            self.domain_right_edge = np.zeros(3, "float64") + 0.5*self.parameters.get('dPeriod', 1)
```

Is it unset?  Perhaps a better solution for the setup would be if `dPeriod` is not set, to not set `domain_*`, so that it will compute the domain from the file?

But perhaps for cosmo sims the bounds are always well-defined?
content.html:
Nathan Goldbaum what is the value of dPeriod for your dataset that spans -2 to 2? The logic in data_structures.py looks to me like:

            self.periodicity = (True, True, True)
            # If we are periodic, that sets our domain width to either 1 or dPeriod.
            self.domain_left_edge = np.zeros(3, "float64") - 0.5*self.parameters.get('dPeriod', 1)
            self.domain_right_edge = np.zeros(3, "float64") + 0.5*self.parameters.get('dPeriod', 1)

Is it unset? Perhaps a better solution for the setup would be if dPeriod is not set, to not set domain_*, so that it will compute the domain from the file?

But perhaps for cosmo sims the bounds are always well-defined?

pullrequest.title: Fixing unitary for datasets without DLE/DRE.  Modify Tipsy domain.

content.raw:
This is the full parameter file:


```

bPeriodic	= 1
bParaRead	= 1
bParaWrite	= 1
achInFile	= starcluster.std
achOutName	= onestar
bStandard	    = 1
dMsolUnit       = 1.0
dKpcUnit        = 1.0
iBinaryOutput	= 1

```

So it's periodic, but not cosmological.  I therefore infer that we probably shouldn't be assuming domain boundaries for periodic non-cosmological datasets.  However I don't have access to the gasoline source code so I can't say for sure.
content.html:
This is the full parameter file:

bPeriodic   = 1
bParaRead   = 1
bParaWrite  = 1
achInFile   = starcluster.std
achOutName  = onestar
bStandard       = 1
dMsolUnit       = 1.0
dKpcUnit        = 1.0
iBinaryOutput   = 1

So it's periodic, but not cosmological. I therefore infer that we probably shouldn't be assuming domain boundaries for periodic non-cosmological datasets. However I don't have access to the gasoline source code so I can't say for sure.

pullrequest.title: Fixing unitary for datasets without DLE/DRE.  Modify Tipsy domain.

content.raw: Yeah, if you specify bPeriodic, but do not give a domain, gasoline will always assume a 1x1x1 box centered at zero.  Those are the defaults that gasoline uses, so yt can safely assume the same thing.
content.html: Yeah, if you specify bPeriodic, but do not give a domain, gasoline will always assume a 1x1x1 box centered at zero. Those are the defaults that gasoline uses, so yt can safely assume the same thing.

content.html: Do you know why that logic doesn't work for the TipsyAuxiliary dataset?

pullrequest.title: Fixing unitary for datasets without DLE/DRE.  Modify Tipsy domain.

content.raw:
Damn it, because I am an idiot.  I stripped down the parameter file when I sent it to you, but I accidentally removed this parameter:

dPeriod = 4

Which sets the domain boundaries at +/- 2 kpc.  Sorry folks.
content.html:
Damn it, because I am an idiot. I stripped down the parameter file when I sent it to you, but I accidentally removed this parameter:

dPeriod = 4

Which sets the domain boundaries at +/- 2 kpc. Sorry folks.
